item.title: Darknightdestiny add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Darknightdestiny add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Reading maketh a full man; and writing an axact man. And, therefore, if a man write little, he need have a present wit; and if he read little, he need have much cunning to seem to know which he doth not." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Darknightdestiny add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Don't say it was delightful; make us say delightful when we've read the description. You see, all those words (horrifying, wonderful, hideous, exquisite) are only like saying to your readers Please will you do the job for me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Darknightdestiny add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Darknightdestiny add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis
